name: mush
content:
mush noun [U]
(SOFT SUBSTANCE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
informal any unpleasant thick soft substance, such as food that has been cooked for too long: If you overcook the cabbage it'll turn to mush.
informal If you say your brain has turned to mush, it means you cannot think clearly.

mush noun [U]
(BOOK/ FILM)
informal If you describe something such as a book or film as mush, you mean that it is too emotional: The movie was just romantic mush.

mush verb
(MOVE WITH DOGS)
[ I or T ] to control dogs pulling a vehicle over snow or dry land: He harnesses his dog team and mushes to the ocean ice. Some have bred, trained and mushed their own sled dogs. She only mushed her dogs 15 miles out the highway before turning around.

mush verb
(CRUSH)
[ T ] informal to crush something, especially cooked food, so it forms a soft mass: Leave some of the beans whole and mush the rest. We mushed everything together, then drained some of the water.

mush (something) together
informal to combine different things so that they are not clear and separate: She's mushed together stories from friends and friends of friends and then made up a story.
